summary: Frontend CRUD UI for conductors (modal, table, delete confirmation, React Query hooks) was implemented, but the backend/domain CRUD + migration work is not evidenced in the diff. Additionally, the React Query cache key used is ['trainedConductors'] rather than the required ['serviceMeetingConductors'], which may prevent required invalidation/refetch behavior per spec.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update/align the ServiceMeetingConductor backend domain to use the specified record data model with exact fields and validate status to only "Available"|"Unavailable".
missing_requirements.reason: No backend files (e.g., backend/main.mo) are shown as added/modified in the diff summary; only frontend files are changed/added.
evidence: File diff summary shows only frontend/* changes; no backend/main.mo modifications listed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Implement complete CRUD backend APIs for ServiceMeetingConductor records with authorization checks; create returns id and sets createdAt; update preserves id/createdAt; delete errors if id missing.
missing_requirements.reason: No backend implementation changes are present in the diff summary; frontend hooks call actor methods but their backend existence/behavior is not evidenced.
evidence: File diff summary shows only frontend/* changes; no backend/main.mo modifications listed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Add conditional migration support on upgrade so conductor storage is initialized without breaking existing state.
missing_requirements.reason: No backend upgrade/migration-related changes are present in the diff summary (no backend/main.mo or backend/migration.mo changes shown).
evidence: File diff summary shows only frontend/* changes; no backend migration/upgrade modifications listed.

missing_requirements.requirement: Create React Query mutations for conductors and ensure they invalidate/refetch the existing ['serviceMeetingConductors'] query so the UI stays consistent after mutations.
missing_requirements.reason: The added query and mutations use the queryKey ['trainedConductors'] (invalidateQueries/queryKey), not the required ['serviceMeetingConductors'] key.

hallucinated_features.description: Introduced a new/alternate React Query cache namespace and naming scheme ('trainedConductors', addTrainedConductor/updateTrainedConductor/deleteTrainedConductor, TrainedServiceMeetingConductor types) instead of the specified ServiceMeetingConductor / ['serviceMeetingConductors'] naming.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest consistently specifies "ServiceMeetingConductor" and explicitly requires invalidation of ['serviceMeetingConductors']; the diff implements parallel naming and a different query key.
